title: Durham Botanic Garden and Houghall Woods Walk Route

description: This walk in Durham explores the University Botanic Gardens before heading into the adjacent Houghall Woods. Start the walk from the car park at the Botanic gardens, just of Hollinside Lane, south of the river. The 10 hectare site has some pleasant footpaths taking you to streams, a woodland garden, artwork pieces, a Carboniferous Garden and glasshouses. Just to the east of the site there's some pleasant woodland trails to pick up around Houghall Woods. In the winter months you can see lots of snowdrops in the gardens, while carpets of bluebells are a real treat during the spring months in the woodland areas. To extend the walk head a mile east and you can pick up the circular walk around the delightful village of Shincliffe. There's more shady trails and river views on the long distance Weardale Way in this area.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For a longer walk try the Durham Riverside Walk and visit some of the highlights of the city including the historic castle and cathedral.

display_address: Durham University Botanic Garden, (Sheep race), Houghall, City of Durham, Durham, County Durham, North East, England, DH1 3DF, United Kingdom
